item.title: The Workshop
item.description: A series of images from The Workshop. The Metal Nibbler Slow Glow fabrication & testing

item.title: Silkworm light diffuser fabrication
item.description: Tommy : I'm a big fan of the series Abstract on Netflix. Whenever I need a reminder that anything is possible I dip in to this wonderful series. I was especially inspired by the episode on Bio-architecture. Researchers at MIT Media Lab led by Neri Oxman created domes from silk fibres created by live silkworms. Traditionally during the silk gathering process, the silkworm is sacrificed to harvest it's silk. However this method allows the silkworms to weave themselves.

item.title: Biography
item.description: EMPATHY STUDIO is a collaborative art group founded by Tommy Hardman & Rebecca Archer. Predominantly working with Light & Movement in an both an interior and exterior setting. They are interested in the emotional narrative between the human, object and environment. The studio creates works that celebrate nature, using supporting technology minimally. Tommy is a multidisiplinary artist. He works across disciplines from sound & visual to engineering fabrication and design. He has been commissioned to create numerous thought provoking interactive experiences to encourage conversation in the environmental and mental health sectors.
